Class JukeBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netbuilder.DataAccess.JukeBox

  • public class JukeBox
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Bruce Pannaman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JukeBox() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static void populateMoney(int moneyEntered)
      This Method creates a Entity Manager from an Entity Manager factory then instantiates MoneyController Class to use method setMoney on it This method is called when the user puts money into the jukebox and the database is updated accordingly
      static java.util.List<Music> populateMusicCatalogue()
      This Method populates an initial music List with data
      static void populatePurchase()
      This Method is called whenever the user makes a purchase and persists -25p to the Money table thus adjusting the total of the AmountAdded column to be the remaining balance.
      static void populateTestPlayQueue()
      This Method will create an entity manager through an entity manager factory.
      static java.util.List<Money> setMoney(int amountEntered)
      This method populates an arraylist of the money that the user has put into the jukebox so that it can be persisted by populateMoney
      static java.util.List<Money> setPurchase()
      This Method creates a new Arraylist with the cost of a purchase (-25p) so that it can be persisted by populatePurchase
      static java.util.List<playQueue> setTestPlaylist(java.util.List<Music> music)
      This method creates a test playlist to see if i can persist something to the playQueue table and should be commented out once I move onto the service layer
      static void startDatabase()
      This method creates an Entity Manager (With persistence unit "MusicPU") through an Entity Manager Factory and then persists the Music List created in populateMusicCatalogue

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Parameters:

      • startDatabase

        public static void startDatabase()
        This method creates an Entity Manager (With persistence unit "MusicPU") through an Entity Manager Factory and then persists the Music List created in populateMusicCatalogue

      • populateMusicCatalogue

        public static java.util.List<Music> populateMusicCatalogue()
        This Method populates an initial music List with data
        Returns:

      • populateMoney

        public static void populateMoney(int moneyEntered)
        This Method creates a Entity Manager from an Entity Manager factory then instantiates MoneyController Class to use method setMoney on it This method is called when the user puts money into the jukebox and the database is updated accordingly

      • setMoney

        public static java.util.List<Money> setMoney(int amountEntered)
        This method populates an arraylist of the money that the user has put into the jukebox so that it can be persisted by populateMoney
        Returns:
        money

      • populatePurchase

        public static void populatePurchase()
        This Method is called whenever the user makes a purchase and persists -25p to the Money table thus adjusting the total of the AmountAdded column to be the remaining balance.

      • setPurchase

        public static java.util.List<Money> setPurchase()
        This Method creates a new Arraylist with the cost of a purchase (-25p) so that it can be persisted by populatePurchase
        Returns:

      • populateTestPlayQueue

        public static void populateTestPlayQueue()
        This Method will create an entity manager through an entity manager factory. Then use persistPlayQueue to persist this playlist to the database

      • setTestPlaylist

        public static java.util.List<playQueue> setTestPlaylist(java.util.List<Music> music)
        This method creates a test playlist to see if i can persist something to the playQueue table and should be commented out once I move onto the service layer
        Returns:
